text.content: This journal will contain advice and tips for running a campaign in this system, starting from session zero to preparing a prologue, then preparing your long-term campaign.

At this time of writing, my preferred approach for planning out a campaign is that of planning it out as a 12-session affair. Think of it as a season in a modern show.

This approach has served me well by first setting clear expectations for myself and the players in terms of what things we shall focus on during the campaign.

I have found great success in using session zero as a springboard for preparing the campaign's various plots in terms of Fronts, a game master tool from Dungeon World, itself a seminal title in the space.

Fronts

I have found that starting with 3 campaign fronts is best, and have each grim portent in each front regularly advance between sessions, either at the start of a session or at the end.

The core rulebook for the system does a brilliant job in laying out a plan for preparing for your campaign in the Press Start chapter. When you have your session zero I strongly suggest you go over each page together with your players and answer the questions together.

In this page I will write some addendums of my own as well link some resources which may help this venture.

World Creation

I found great success using Azgaars Fantasy Map Generator to prepare for my campaign. You can generate a landmass, export it as an image then import it to Foundry as a scene, allowing everyone on the table to work on the world map together.

You can use Foundry's map notes under the Journal Notes and pin them on the map for locations. This can be enhanced with the usage of the Pin Cushion module.

Prologue

As suggested in the CRB, a good prologue should have the campaign hit the ground running and give an exciting welcome to your players to the world you have created together.

When preparing the prologue, it is best to target for a couple sessions worth of play and for it be a more guided experience than general play. This will give everyone time to familiarize themselves with the PCs and for the players to find out their character's voices.
